articles.description: The White House Covid-19 outbreak is undermining President Donald Trump's narrative that it's safe to open up the country and that diagnostic testing is of limited importance.

articles.title: Off-duty officer saves hiker from a whirlpool
articles.description: An off-duty California Highway Patrol Officer helped save a 24-year-old hiker who fell into a whirlpool at a popular California trail.

articles.author: By Julia Hollingsworth and Adam Renton, CNN
articles.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Updates from around the world
articles.description: The global coronavirus pandemic has brought countries to a standstill. Here's the latest updates on worldwide Covid-19 cases, deaths, government responses and more.

articles.author: By Julia Hollingsworth and Kocha Olarn, CNN
articles.title: The future of tourism in the coronavirus era: Asia may hold answers to what's ahead
articles.description: Experts warn that even with new initiatives, travel at pre-Covid levels could be years away. And even when it happens, we might never travel in the same way again.
articles.content:
Julia Hollingsworth and Kocha Olarn, CNNPublished 11th May 2020
Bangkok, Thailand (CNN) It's a sunny day on Bangkok's most famous tourist street, and shopkeeper Cletana Thangworachai is open for business.
Her Khao San Road shop is crowded with shiny magnets… [+9855 chars]

articles.author: Alaa Elassar, CNN
articles.title: Ice cream shop closes one day after reopening because customers didn't follow social distancing rules
articles.description: Nearly all states partially reopened last week and businesses across the country are preparing to welcome customers back. But because of the coronavirus pandemic, things are far from normal.

articles.author: Alicia Lee, CNN
articles.title: Bono celebrates 60th birthday by sharing playlist of 60 songs that saved his life
articles.description: Millions of fans turned their attention to Bono on Sunday as they helped wish him a happy 60th birthday, but the U2 frontman took the day to thank the 60 artists who made him the musician he is today by releasing a playlist of "60 Songs That Saved My Life."

articles.title: Sen. Lamar Alexander to self-quarantine after staffer tests positive for coronavirus
articles.description: Sen. Lamar Alexander of Tennessee will self-quarantine for 14 days after a staffer in his office tested positive for the novel coronavirus, his office announced Sunday evening.
articles.content:
(CNN)Sen. Lamar Alexander of Tennessee will self-quarantine for 14 days after a staffer in his office tested positive for the novel coronavirus, his office announced Sunday evening.

Cluster of Covid-19 cases linked to California birthday party
articles.description: A birthday party in March was behind a cluster of coronavirus cases in Pasadena, California, according to health officials. CNN's Paul Vercammen has more.

articles.author: Sara Sidner, Leslie Perrot, Artemis Moshtaghian and Susannah Cullinane, CNN
articles.title: South Dakota Sioux tribe refuses to take down checkpoints that governor says are illegal
articles.description: The Cheyenne River Sioux Tribe in South Dakota is refusing to end coronavirus checkpoints declared illegal by the state's governor, saying they are the best tool they have to stop the virus from spreading.

articles.author: Alicia Lee, CNN
articles.title: A family serenaded their grandma at a Michigan living facility for Mother's Day, and other grannies joined in
articles.description: It was meant to be a Mother's Day surprise for one when 26-year-old Rebecca Roy and her family sang "You Are My Sunshine" outside their grandma's senior living facility in Waterford, Michigan.

articles.title: Patriots owner donates ring from infamous Super Bowl win
articles.description: New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft is auctioning off his championship ring from Super Bowl LI as part of the "All In Challenge", a celebrity fundraising effort to feed for those in need during the coronavirus pandemic.

articles.title: Princeton names its first black valedictorian in the university's history
articles.description: Princeton University has named its first black valedictorian in the school's 274-year history.

articles.title: Video appears to show Ahmaud Arbery at construction site before shooting, family lawyer says
articles.description: Surveillance video from a construction site appears to show Ahmaud Arbery shortly before he was shot and killed while running in a south Georgia neighborhood in February.
articles.content:

articles.title: US chief of naval operations to self-quarantine
articles.description: The chief of naval operations will self-quarantine after he came in contact with a family member who has tested positive for the coronavirus, according to a US official.

articles.author: Taylor Barnes and Theresa Waldrop, CNN
articles.title: Remains of 25 people found in mass grave in Mexico's Jalisco state
articles.description: Law enforcement in Mexico's Jalisco state discovered a mass grave with the bodies of at least 25 unidentified people, the prosecutor's office in that state said.

articles.title: Start your Monday smart: Graduations, Congress, reopen, police, Disney, baseball, UFC
articles.description: Graduations go online. Congress heads back to the Hill. More states reopen. Slain officers are honored. Disney sings. (Korean) baseball and UFC begin play. Here's what the next six days will bring.
articles.content:

articles.author: Opinion by Dean Obeidallah
articles.title: Trump's jaw-dropping attack on California's voting plan
articles.description: Dean Obeidallah writes that President Donald Trump's attacks on both mail-in and in-person voting arrangements for California's May 12 congressional election -- especially his suggestion that some ballots shouldn't be counted -- are a threat to US democracy
